alerts.danger-depth-exceeds-zone: The danger's depth may not exceed the zone's depth nor can a danger have a depth > 0 when a zone's depth is infinite (equal to 0).
alerts.json-invalid: data is not in a valid object format.
alerts.no-trigger-if-not-on-combat-scene: Danger Zones do not trigger while you are not active on the current combat scene.
alerts.select-zone-start: Select a start location for this zone. Selected area will snap to grid and represent the top left corner of this zone.
alerts.select-zone-end: Select an end location for this zone. Selected area will snap to grid and represent the lower right corner of this zone.
alerts.select-target: Select a location in the zone for the danger to target. Selected area will snap to grid and represent the top left corner of the danger's target.
alerts.select-warpgate-target: Select a location in the zone for the danger to target. The top left space of non-square danger dimensions will resolve to the top left grid in the target area.
alerts.user-selection-exited: You have exited from danger location selection prematurely. Zone trigger execution stopped.
alerts.zone-copied: The zone was copied successfully! Please review the zone dimensions.
alerts.zone-copy-fail: Oops, there was an issue copying the zone.

edit-form.actor.label: Actor
edit-form.allInArea.label: Danger Targets All Tokens
edit-form.allInArea.description: If more than one token is in a target area, they will all be targeted. Otherwise only one random token is targeted.
edit-form.basics.label: Basics
edit-form.bleed.label: Bleed
edit-form.bleed.description: If set, the danger's boundary (based on its width, height and depth) can partially exceed this zone's boundary. Danger effects will span into the bleed but tokens that are not in the zone boundary will not be targeted in the bleed. This ensures that each grid in the zone has an equal chance of being randomly targeted. If not set, units closer to the zone's center will have a greater likelihood of being targeted.

boundary.bottom.label: Bottom
boundary.choose.label: Select Grid Dimensions
boundary.elevation.label: Elevation Bounds
boundary.end.label: End Grid Location
boundary.label: Dimensions
boundary.description: A zone's dimensions form a cube that extends between the start and end x/y locations and from the elevation bottom up to, but not including, the top. A zone where the bottom and top elevation matches is considered to have infinite depth.
boundary.start.label: Start Grid Location
boundary.top.label: Top
boundary.x.label: x
boundary.y.label: y

edit-form.clear.label: Clear
edit-form.combatantInZone.description: The zone will only trigger if the current combatant is within the zone.
edit-form.combatantInZone.label: Combatant is in zone
edit-form.convert-global.notes: Save a version of this global zone to this scene (the global zone will still exist).

delay.description:
Delays the danger from starting for a given amount of milliseconds.
For loops, the delay will be added between each loop.
If the maximum value exceeds the minimum value, then the delay will randomly vary each time within this range.
delay.label: Delay Start
delay.min.label: Minimum
delay.max.label: Maximum

edit-form.enabled.label: Active
edit-form.initiative-count.label: Initiative Count
edit-form.flavor.label: Flavor
edit-form.flavor.description: This text will output to a chat message when this zone triggers. Flavor will only output once regardless of how many loops are in the zone.
edit-form.light.replace.label: Ambient Lighting
edit-form.light.replace.description: Choose what to do with existing Danger Zone created ambient light when this zone triggers.
edit-form.likelihood.label: Likelihood
edit-form.likelihood.description: Set the likelihood that a danger's effects will execute on zone trigger.
edit-form.loop.label: Loop Count
edit-form.loop.description: Set the number of danger executions when this zone is triggered. Each loop will have the likelihood assessed separately when executed.
edit-form.name: Configure Zone
edit-form.operation.description:
Determines the trigger operation of each loop.
  Sequential: Next loop fires once the current loop completes.
  Staggered: All loops fire at the same time and 'Delay Start' is calculated separately for each loop.
  Together: 'Delay Start' is calculated and performed once and then all loops are triggered directly after.
edit-form.operation.label: Loop Operation
edit-form.placeTemplate.label: Choose Location
edit-form.placeTemplate.description: On trigger, you will be prompted to select the scene location to target with the danger (otherwise the location is randomly selected from within the bounds of the zone and bleed). If the location that you select is fully outside of the zone, the danger effects will generate but tokens outside of the zone will not be targeted.
edit-form.promptElevation.label: Skip Elevation Prompt
edit-form.random.label: Randomize
edit-form.random.description: All zones in this scene that share the same trigger are grouped and only one is triggered at random. Assign a weight to control how often one triggers in relation to the others.
edit-form.replace.label: Lasting Effects
edit-form.replace.description: Choose what to do with existing Danger Zone created lasting effects when this zone triggers.
edit-form.runUntilTokenFound.label: Always Hits a Token
edit-form.runUntilTokenFound.description: The danger will target an area of the zone where at least one token is present, if able.
edit-form.single-run.description: This section executes at most once, after the first likelihood success, and regardless of the loop count for this zone

source.actor.label: Source Actor
source.area.label: Source Area
source.area.description: Defines a source area within the zone which may influence targeting
source.description: The source may influence when and if a zone triggers. Many danger parts can be defined in relation to the zone's source.
source.label: Source
source.target.label: Targeting Influence
source.target.description:
Limits targeting within zone based on the zone's source areas.
 *has no influence on aura triggered zones or ones where GM chooses target location
source.trigger.description:
Have source actor determine if zone triggers.
    * Has no influence on zones triggered manually or by API.
For combat triggers where 'Only source can trigger zone', the source must be in the scope as a combatant.
    Turn: the combatant equating to turn.
    Other: must be a combatant in combat.
source.trigger.label: Trigger Influence

triggers.scene: Zone only triggers if source on scene
triggers.source: Only source actor can trigger zone

edit-form.stretch.description: Adjusts the danger's area of effect so that the stretch location remains fixed while the zone's top and bottom still constrict the possible initial target. 'Ground' uses 0 as the final bottom and 'Sky' uses 99999 as the final top. Example: Given 'rising from bottom' in a zone with bottom=2, top=10, and danger depth=3, and an initial target of bottom=5/top=8. The stretch will keep the top target = 8 but drop the bottom to 2, which equals the bottom of the zone.
edit-form.stretch.label: Stretch
edit-form.target.description: On trigger, the danger is placed within the zone's boundaries and tokens within the danger's dimensions become eligble targets.
edit-form.targetCombatant.description: For combat scoped triggers, this will target the location of the combatant and solely target the combatant unless 'Danger Targets All Tokens' is enabled.
edit-form.targetCombatant.label: Target Current Combatant
edit-form.title.label: Title
edit-form.token-targeting.label: Target
edit-form.token-condition-ex.description: List of condition or effect names that, if active on token, will exclude that token from being a target of the danger. Separate each name with a pipe '|' to list more than one.
edit-form.token-condition-ex.label: Exclude if condition/effect
edit-form.token-disposition.label: Disposition
edit-form.trigger.description: The trigger defines an event that will cause the danger to be placed within the zone. Documentation at https://github.com/napolitanod/Danger-Zone/wiki/Triggers.
edit-form.trigger.label: Trigger
edit-form.type.label: Danger
edit-form.wall.replace.label: Walls
edit-form.wall.replace.description: Choose what to do with existing Danger Zone created walls when this zone triggers.
edit-form.weight.label: Weight

scene.confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this zone?
scene.copy-danger-zone: Copy a zone from another scene. The dimensions will be defaulted to this scene's width and height.
scene.description: Zones define where a danger can happen, when and to whom. Each zone contains a danger. Documentation at https://github.com/napolitanod/Danger-Zone/wiki/Zones.
scene.executor.label: Launch Danger Zone Executor
scene.header.name: Configure Scene Zones
scene.label: Danger Zone
scene.random-trigger.label: Random Manual Trigger
scene.title: Title

setting.chat-details-to-gm.label: Chat Zone Details to GM on Trigger
setting.chat-details-to-gm.description: Will send a private chat message to GM that includes details on the danger zone on trigger, such as target location, eligible tokens, and targeted tokens.
setting.danger-zone-types-config.name: Dangers
setting.danger-zone-types-config.label: Configure Dangers
setting.display-danger-boundary.label: Highlight Danger Target Area
setting.display-executor.label: Include Executor as Zone Button (Beta)
setting.display-executor.description: BETA! Adds the Danger Zone executor to the list of scene buttons. Clicking the button will launch the executor. The Danger Zone executor can be used to executor individual components of a danger or zone and sculpt some functionality on the fly.
setting.open-socket.label: Players Can Trigger API
setting.open-socket.description: Enabling this settings allows players to use the 'dangerZone.triggerZone' API in macros (dangerZone.triggerZone() is passed to the GM's session to execute, which requires that the GM be logged in at the time that the macro is run).
setting.display-danger-boundary.description: Temporarily highlights the area targeted by a danger when the zone is triggered (GM's session only).
setting.scene-control-button-display.label: Display Clear Lasting Effects Button
setting.scene-control-button-display.description: Toggles the display of the Clear Danger Zone Lasting Effects button within the scene control buttons tiles grouping
setting.scene-control-light-button-display.label: Display Clear Ambient Light Button
setting.scene-control-light-button-display.descr: Toggles the display of the Clear Ambient Light button within the scene control buttons lighting control grouping
setting.scene-control-wall-button-display.label: Display Clear Wall Button
setting.scene-control-wall-button-display.descri: Toggles the display of the Clear Wall button within the scene control buttons walls control grouping
setting.scene-trigger-button-display.label: Zone Trigger Display Location
setting.scene-trigger-button-display.description: Set the location where the zone triggers will display. Triggers only display for the GM when viewing the active scene.
setting.types-button-display.label: Display Dangers Button
setting.types-button-display.description: Toggles the display of the Dangers button at the bottom of the scenes side bar
setting.scene-enabled-default.label: New Zone Active by Default
setting.scene-enabled-default.description: Select whether or not new danger zones default to active when you first create them.

display.label: Display Button in Token Form Header
display.description: Determine if and how to show a button in the scene form header. This button will launch the 'Configure Danger Zones' form.

setting.token-depth-multiplier.label: Token Depth Multiplier
setting.token-depth-multiplier.description: For purposes of zone depth targeting, set a multiplier that calculates how tall a token is in relation to the scene distance, the token's scale, and the number of grid squares that that token takes up. A token in a single grid square with a scale of 1.0, a scene distance of 5, and a multiplier of 1.2 will have a tallness of 6 (1 * 1.0 * 5 * 1.2).
setting.zone-exclusion-tag.label: Block Zone Tag
setting.zone-exclusion-tag.description: Enter the tag that you will use to indicate that a wall, light, tile, token or drawing blocks the occupied grid from being included in the zone. Note that the 'Tagger' module is required or, for drawings, using this as the Text Label also works.

source.danger.description:
The source is an actor defined within the zone form.
Define how this danger part should be applied in relation to the targets and the source.
source.label: Source

target.none: Do not target based on source area
target.both: In or adjacent to source area

treatment.ignore: Do not apply to source actor (if targeted)
treatment.only: Apply to source actor instead of targets

active-effect.delay.label: Delay Start
active-effect.description: Adds an active effect to targeted tokens.
active-effect.label: Active Effect
active-effect.limit.description: If a token already has this effect applied, a second one will not be added.
active-effect.limit.label: Max 1 Per Token
active-effect.macro.description: Determine if active effect macros should repeat on each turn of the associated token.
active-effect.macro.label: Macro Repeat
active-effect.notes: Active effect will be transferred to each danger target.
active-effect.edit.title: Edit Active Effect
active-effect.delete.title: Delete Active Effect

type-form.cleared.info: has been deleted from this danger.

type-form.dimensions.label: Dimensions
type-form.dimensions.description:
Width and height dimensions are measured in scene grids.
If the width or height = 0 then that dimension will default to the zone's dimension.
For depth, specify the difference in grid units between the top and bottom elevations.
A depth of 0 will default to the zone's depth.

source.swap.description: Plays the effect so that it appears to come from target and towards the source.
source.swap.label: Reverse Flow

foregroundEffect.repeat.label: Number of Repeats
foregroundEffect.duration.label: Duration

mutate.actor.label: Token Actor Data
mutate.actor.description: Updates token actor by passing in object data. Expects key: value pairs. This will be wrapped in {brackets} and passed as an object to the Warpgate actor mutation.

mutate.description: Transforms targeted tokens with revertable changes using Warpgate. This is in beta and form layout / data collection is subject to change.
mutate.embedded.label: Embedded Data
mutate.embedded.description: Updates token items or active effects by passing in object data. Expects key: value pairs. This will be wrapped in {brackets} and passed as an object to the Warpgate embedded mutation.

mutate.permanent.label: Mutation is Permanent
mutate.tag.label: Token Tag
mutate.token.label: Token Data
mutate.token.description: Updates token by passing in object data. Expects key: value pairs. This will be wrapped in {brackets} and passed as an object to the Warpgate token mutation.
